bibl.title: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, October 26, 1922

div1.p: LePrince thanks Carter for introducing his ideas on mosquitos and drainage into technical schools.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, October 26, 1922
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Oct 26
Dear Dr Carter
div1.p:
I am exceedingly obliged to you
for the criticisms & wise suggestions
you sent me re letter & data relating
to our effort to get mosquito drainage
ideas into our technical schools - I
have been glad to accept and use
every one of them - As the data is being
sent by the committee I have had
to modify one or several items to suit
them since original was prepared-
It is my intention to start the project
forward before the session of the
National Mal. Committee takes
place but all of the committee are
of the family that is never “at home”
& things go slow - as three weeks
for an answer -

Dr Welch, state H. O Alabama
is preparing for taking up
legislation re impounded water
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
and asked me to give him
an outline of the essential
points - I sent him same & enclose
copy to you - as it appeared too
extreme, I worded page 5 line 16
so as to modify it all-.
I thought it best that he should
have outline of what happens so
that there would no question as
to the need of the requirements-
